function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'foo' to reach function 'main'?
loop_reachability: Is it possible that the loop with condition 'e != 1' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'e != 1' always executed?
Can the loop with condition 'i < 6' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'i < 6' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'e != 1' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i < 6' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Is variable 'a (line 1)' used after its definition?
Does the value assigned to 'c (line 1)' affect subsequent computations?
liveness: Is variable 'g' live at the end of function 'foo'?
Does variable 'x' remain in use at the end of function 'foo'?
dead_code: Can the program actually reach the statement: “int g[] = { };”?
